data.title: Shaw Communications Inc.
data.meta_description: News about Shaw Communications Inc., including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS

INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS; Loss Narrows at Canadian Cable Operator

Shaw Communications reports net loss of 13.2 million Canadian dollars for fiscal third quarter ended May 31, compared with 79.3 million Canadian dollars one year earlier; sales rose 5.9 percent to 522 million Canadian dollars (S)

By Bloomberg News

Canadian Cable Unit Sold

Shaw Communications Inc, Canada's second-largest cable television company, sells its cable systems in Nova Scotia to Bragg Communications for $143.5 million (US) to reduce debt (S)

By Bloomberg News

COMPANY NEWS

COMPANY NEWS; SHAW OF CANADA AGREES TO BUY SMALLER CABLE RIVAL

Shaw Communications agrees to buy Moffat Communications, gaining total control of Canadian cable television markets west of Ontario, plus some cable properties in Texas (S)

By Bloomberg News

WORLD BUSINESS BRIEFING: AMERICAS

WORLD BUSINESS BRIEFING: AMERICAS; CABLE COMPANIES GET CLOSER

Rogers Communications Inc and Shaw Communications Inc, Canada's largest cable companies, agree to swap some assets and merge Internet operations, escalating their war with telephone utilities for supremacy in electronic commerce; two will combine Internet divisions, providing single national portal (S)

By Timothy Pritchard

COMPANY NEWS

COMPANY NEWS; SHAW IN $312 MILLION DEAL FOR FUNDY COMMUNICATIONS

Shaw Communications Inc to buy Fundy Communications Inc for $312 million, including $102 million of class B shares (S)

By Dow Jones

COMPANY NEWS

COMPANY NEWS; SHAW AGREES TO BUY TWO CABLE SYSTEMS IN NOVA SCOTIA

Shaw Communications Inc agrees to pay $167 million (Canadian), or $111 million (US), for 75 percent stake in Access Communications Inc of Nova Scotia, and all of Access Television Bedford/Sackville Ltd, to expand in eastern Canada (S)

By Bloomberg News

Shaw Sells Part of Its Cable Stakes in U.S.

Shaw Communications Inc, second-largest cable television operator in Canada, sells stake s in American companies, the At Home Corp and Terayon Communications Systems, for $80.6 million (Canadian), or $54.1 million (US), to capitalize on huge share-price gains (S)

By Bloomberg News

Cable Concern Splits Canada Operations

Shaw Communications Inc, Canada's second-largest cable company, will split its media and cable operations into two separate companies (S)

By Bloomberg News
